Title: Guardiola warns that Man City have little room for errors in title race
Summary: Pep Guardiola warns that Manchester City have little room for errors in title race . Last weekend’s loss at Newcastle has left them seven points behind leaders Arsenal . City lost their fourth game of the season to Newcastle United .

Title: FG to introduce emergency response fund for GBV survivors
Summary: Federal Government to establish emergency response fund for GBV survivors . Minister of Women’s Affairs, Hajiya Imaan Suleiman-Ibrahim, disclosed this at the launch of a research report on GBV .

Title: Ganduje, Barau accuse Kano govt of politicising insecurity
Summary: Dr. Abdullahi Umar Ganduje and Deputy President of the Senate, Barau I. Jibrin, have dismissed allegations by the Kano State Government of politicising insecurity . Former National Chairman of the All Progressives Congress (APC) Dr. Ganduja and Barau accused of making inciting comments capable of worsening

Title: Go after bandits attacking, killing Nigerians, Christian elders task FG
Summary: Kogi East Christian Elders Forum (KECEF) urges the Federal Government to intensify efforts against bandits . Government must take the offensive rather than remain reactive in the fight against bandits, the KECEF said .

Title: FG didn’t pay ransom to rescue schoolchildren in Kebbi, Niger, Kwara – Senator
Summary: Senator Yemi Adaramodu has dismissed claims that the Federal Government paid ransom to secure the release of schoolgirls recently abducted in Kebbi and Niger States . The Ekiti South Senator stated this on Friday during a Senate session .

Title: Who owns Detty December? … Nigerians ready for it
Summary: The month of December is a special month for Nigerians . Of all the months of the year, it is the hottest; as per entertainment . It's Detty December .

Title: Global drug trade fuels instability in coup-hit G/Bissau
Summary: "Today, Bissau's cocaine market is booming once again," it said . "It has arguably become more profitable than at any point in the country's history," it added .

Title: Kidnap Terror Returns: From Abuja to North, communities live in fear again
Summary: Nigeria has been gripped by a wave of coordinated kidnappings from the Federal Capital Territory to the far North-West . In just two weeks, the country has been rocked by the attacks . From Abuja to North, communities live in fear again .

Title: Aeropolitics: Without policy backing, partnerships, Nigerian airlines can’t thrive internationally — Demuren
Summary: Stakeholders in the air transport sector gathered in Lagos to hear former NCAA D-G,Demuren, assess Nigeria’s position in international aeropolitics . Demuren: Without policy backing, partnerships, Nigerian airlines can’t thrive internationally .

Title: FRSC confirms six dead in Awka–Onitsha expressway crash
Summary: FRSC confirms six dead in Awka–Onitsha expressway crash . Six people died in a collision between a truck and a bus at Nawfia axis, near Enugu-Agidi Junction .

Title: Economic hardship, others deepening mental health crisis — Psychiatrists
Summary: The Association of Psychiatrists in Nigeria has raised concerns over the state of the country’s mental health system . The psychiatrists highlighted lack of access to care, high treatment costs, absence of insurance coverage, rising substance abuse among youths as pressing threats to public health .

Title: Three die in Kano fuel tanker explosion
Summary: Kano State Fire Service confirmed the incidents in a statement released on Saturday and signed by its Public Relations Officer, ACFO Saminu Yusif Abdullahi . Title: Tinubu hails Nigeria’s return to maritime organisation council after 14 years
Summary: President Bola Tinubu welcomed Nigeria’s election into the Council of the International Maritime Organisation for the 2026–2027 biennium . The election, which saw Nigeria re-elected into Category C of the IMO Council, took place in London on Friday, November 28 . With this election, Nigeria joins 19 other

Title: NAHCON boss mourns Islamic scholar Sheikh Dahiru Bauchi
Summary: Chairman/CEO of the National Hajj Commission, of Nigeria, Prof. Abdullahi Usman has expressed deep sorrow over the passing of renowned Islamic scholar, Sheikh Dahiru Usman Bauchi . Usman said that the late Islamic icon remained a strong supporter of pilgrims’ welfare, as he played special roles in the growth and

Title: C'River approves loans for 500 small businesses
Summary: Cross River State Government has approved 500 small business owners to access the SMEDAN–Sterling Bank single-digit interest loan facility . In a statement made available to PUNCH Online on Saturday, the government said the entrepreneurs were screened and cleared for the facility . Governor Bassey Otu also sponsored 1,000 free CAC certificates
